title: Pedro Nolasco
text:
Pedro Nolasco (February 2, 1962 – September 15, 1995) was a <a href="Dominican%20Republic">Dominican</a> <a href="boxing">boxer</a>, who won the bronze medal in the men's bantamweight category at the <a href="1984%20Summer%20Olympics">1984 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a>, United States.
This was the first Olympic medal of the Dominican Republic. A year earlier he won a silver at the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%201983%20Pan%20American%20Games">1983 Pan American Games</a>. He was born in La Romana, Dominican Republic.
Nolasco turned pro in 1986 and had limited success, possibly a result of having moved up the professional ladder too quickly. In 1987 he dropped a pair of fights to future champion <a href="Tony%20Lopez%20%28boxer%29">Tony Lopez</a>. Later in the year he lost a by first-round knockout to former world champ <a href="Victor%20Callejas">Victor Callejas</a>. In 1989 he took on <a href="Maurizio%20Stecca">Maurizio Stecca</a> for the newly created WBO Featherweight Title, but lost in a 6th-round TKO.
Nolasco was shot and killed in an attempted robbery at his home in La Romana on September 15, 1995 at the age of 33.
